div.p: Observed climate anomalies in early winter of El Niño-decay year. Regressed anomalies of a sea level pressure (SLP), b surface air temperature (SAT) and sea surface temperature (SST) and c sea ice concentration (SIC) (shading) and 925-hPa wind velocity (vectors; limited to 50°–82°N) in early winter onto the El Niño–Southern Oscillation (ENSO) index in preceding winter (ENSO(–1)). SAT is shown over land or ice while SST is shown over open ocean in b. Hatching in a and black-dotted contours in b, c indicate statistical significance (for SIC in c) at the p < 0.05 level, and thick black contours in c indicate mean SIC of 10%. d Time series of the detrended ENSO index (1-year forward shift) and SIC anomalies averaged in the Barents–Kara (BK) Seas (70°–80°N, 50°–90°E)
